body_html:
Maybe it could be

tf.py_func(func, [x], [tf.float32]) -> returns list of tf.float32
tf.py_func(func, [x], tf.float32) -> returns single tf.float32

This is similar to session.run which returns either list of numpy arrays or single numpy array depending on whether input is a list
body_text:
Maybe it could be
tf.py_func(func, [x], [tf.float32]) -> returns list of tf.float32
tf.py_func(func, [x], tf.float32) -> returns single tf.float32

This is similar to session.run which returns either list of numpy arrays or single numpy array depending on whether input is a list
body:
Maybe it could be 

```
tf.py_func(func, [x], [tf.float32]) -> returns list of tf.float32
tf.py_func(func, [x], tf.float32) -> returns single tf.float32
```

This is similar to `session.run` which returns either list of numpy arrays or single numpy array depending on whether input is a list
